FuncDef:
The load-balance per-packet command configures per-packet load balancing for data channels in a virtual cluster.
The undo load-balance per-packet command cancels the per-packet load balancing mode for virtual cluster data channels.
By default, load balancing is performed for data channels in a virtual cluster in per-flow mode.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If load balancing among data channels in a virtual cluster is uneven, you can run this command to enable per-packet load balancing for data channels in the virtual cluster. The packets are evenly allocated to the links that participate in the load balancing based on the arrival sequence of packets. In this way, the data channels of the virtual cluster are evenly distributed.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
